lead_paragraph: The president said that the fight against Islamic State forces was not being lost, but that more should be done to help Iraq recapture lost territory.

headline.print_headline: Defending ISIS Policy, Obama Acknowledges Flaws in Effort So Far
headline.main: Defending ISIS Policy, Obama Acknowledges Flaws in Effort So Far

snippet: The president said that the fight against Islamic State forces was not being lost, but that more should be done to help Iraq recapture lost territory.
abstract: Pres Obama interview in The Atlantic defends his policy regarding fight against Islamic State forces in Middle East, acknowledging more should be done to help Iraqis recapture lost territory; attributes fall of Ramadi to Iraqi government's failure to fortify Anbar Province, and reiterates his decision not to increase US troops, calling for patience.
